page.title: 06Roadside flowers,Marchwood.
page.content: The main road through the area is the Marchwood By-Pass which runs from Fawley to Totton and the M27.There is lots of heavy traffic including oil tankers from the refinery.Grass verges line the road and{many wild flowers have grown.In early July in a 50 metre stretch{we found 37 different species.Only a few centimetres from the road smaller plants grow close to the ground such as pineapple weed, shepherd's purse and scarlet pimpernel.Further away from the road were purple and white clover followed by chickweed and dandelion.Pink herb robert and clumps of white cow parsley were interspersed with giant ox-eye daisies.Tufted vetches entwined between them in a mass of blue.Few motorists notice this lovely 'garden' as they speed on their way.
